profile.name: Vedanth Reddy Doddannagari
profile.bio: Proactive and driven data science graduate student with a keen interest in leveraging cutting-edge analytics to uncover actionable insights. I am currently pursuing an MS in Data Science at the University of New Haven, building upon a solid foundation in information technology from CMR College of Engineering and Technology.

portfolioItems.title: Uber and Lyft Data Analysis
portfolioItems.description: Conducted thorough data analysis on Uber & Lyft data using AWS services (EC2, S3, Glue, Athena) and Power BI.Followed CRISP-DM methodology to structure project execution, delivering actionable insights for decision-making.Demonstrated proficiency in cloud-based integration, enhancing data management and visualization capabilities

portfolioItems.title: Optimization and Lego Car Racing
portfolioItems.description: The Lego Car Racing Project innovatively designed competitive Lego cars by leveraging mathematical modeling and experimentation. Through meticulous analysis of factors such as aerodynamics and weight, a sophisticated optimization model was crafted to maximize performance within budget constraints. Overcoming challenges, including code implementation and part valuation, the project underscored the importance of collaboration and problem-solving. The culmination of the project yielded valuable insights into the intricate interplay of design, performance, and cost considerations, paving the way for future advancements in Lego car design methodologies.
